ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Charm Kiting...
ygData.msgSnippet: You can make a swarmattack hotkey too /pet attack /pet target that way once the pet s attacking you have it up in your window for easy recharming or dotting
ygData.messageBody:
You can make a swarmattack hotkey too

/pet attack
/pet target

that way once the pet's attacking you have it up in your window for easy
recharming or dotting

Also... I tab it into the tab spool as well, in case I get hit or targets
change unexpectedly.

Add a /pet report health key to get accurate reports on your pets health
(WAY more accurate than the laggy health bar)...

and you're off and running. If you have the fortune to have a clicky
invis item of any type (tiniest cloak of the darkest night, boots of the
mosquito, and a ring... forget the ring name) then you can let the pet get
REAL low before you break charm and keel it with dots/bellow.

It's quite an amazing way to farm XP. In higher levels we are, in the
right camp, the best XP soloers in the game... hands down.

Raub

At 08:26 AM 02/07/2003 +0100, you wrote:
>No not really. The first charm song you get only works on NPCs not Pets. So
>once you have a pet you have to wait until it fades before you can add it
>again.. Playing a bard requries you to move and smash the keyboard, better
>get used to it, hehe.
>The level 39 song last around a minute, but use your mana so unless you have
>insane mana regen you will run out.
>Charm kiting using first charm song (As I recall it)
>
>1. Hit selo (or get a sow)
>2. Charm your intended pet
>3. Sic pet on mob
>4. retarget pet (F1,F1)
>5. Repeat from one until Pet is low on health (keep out of their melee
>range)
>6. When pet is low on health, use Bellow DOTS (AE or DD) and selo to finish
>it of so you get the exp.
>
>It will get much easier when you get the 1 min charm song and even easier if
>you have a sow or when you get 1 min selo
>
>Musiker
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: KAZ [mailto:kazvorpal@...]

>

>have to worry about it "wearing off" the way chanters (and necros, druids,
>shamen, et cetera) do?
